page.title: 04Upper Plumstead: 05430177
page.content: This is part of the north slope of Shooters Hill with large public open spaces at the top and bottom. The area around Plumstead Common has Victorian and Edwardian houses and artisan's terraces reaching up the hill towards 1930s private semi-detached houses, built on the sites of large houses towards the top of the hill. In Genesta Road there are 4 houses designed by the architect Lubetkin. There is very little council housing, or post-war building. The residents are a mixture of professional and working-classes including a proportion of Indian immigrants. A major local concern is the proposed East London river crossing, a bridge over the Thames plus a motorway type road near the area.
